Name: Access Control Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate access control policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Access Control Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate procedures to facilitate the implementation of the access control policy and associated access controls.

Name: Access Control Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current access control policy.

Name: Access Control Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current access control procedures.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall identify and select information system account types to support organizational missions/business functions.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall assign account managers for information system accounts.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall establish conditions for group and role membership.

Name: Account Management - Automated System Account Management
Description: The organization shall employ automated mechanisms to support the management of information system accounts.

Name: Account Management - Removal of Temporary / Emergency Accounts
Description: The information system shall automatically remove/disable temporary and emergency accounts after a set period of time.

Name: Account Management - Disable Inactive Accounts
Description: The information system shall automatically disable inactive accounts after a set period of time.

Name: Account Management - Automated Audit Actions
Description: The information system shall automatically audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling, and removal actions, and notifies the proper personnel.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall specify authorized users of the information system, group, and role membership, and access authorizations (i.e. privileges) and other attributes (as required) for each account.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall require approvals by assigned personnel for requests to create information system accounts.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall create, enable, modify, disable, and remove information system accounts in accordance with organization defined procedures.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall monitor the use of information system accounts.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall notify account managers when accounts are no longer required.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall notify account managers when users are terminated or transferred.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall notify account managers when individual information system usage or need-to-know changes.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall authorize access to the information system based on a valid access authorization.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall authorize access to the information system based on intended system usage.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall authorize access to the information system based on other attributes as required by the organization or associated missions/business functions.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall review accounts for compliance with account management requirements.

Name: Account Management
Description: The organization shall establish a process for reissuing shared/group account credentials (if deployed) when individuals are removed from the group.

Name: Access Enforcement
Description: The information system shall enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with access control policies.

Name: Information Flow Enforcement
Description: The information system shall enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between interconnected systems based on defined information flow control policies.

Name: Separation of Duties
Description: The organization shall separate organization-defined duties of individuals.

Name: Separation of Duties
Description: The organization shall document separation of duties of individuals.

Name: Separation of Duties
Description: The organization shall define information system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

Name: Least Privilege
Description: The organization shall employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized access for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) which are necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in accordance with the organizational missions and business functions

Name: Least Privilege - Authorize Access To Security Functions
Description: The organization shall explicitly authorize access to organization-defined security functions (deployed in hardware, software, and firmware) and security-relevant information.

Name: Least Privilege - Non-Privileged Access for Non-Security Functions
Description: The organization shall require that users of information system accounts, or roles, with access to organization-defined security functions or security-relevant information, use non-privileged accounts, or roles, when accessing non-security functions.

Name: Least Privilege - Privileged Accounts
Description: The organization shall restrict privileged accounts on the information system to organization-defined personnel or roles.

Name: Least Privilege - Auditing Use of Privileged Functions
Description: The information system shall audit the execution of privileged functions.

Name: Least Privilege - Prohibit Non-Privileged Users From Executing Privileged Functions
Description: The information system shall prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing, or altering implemented security safeguards/countermeasures.

Name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
Description: The information system shall enforce an organization-defined limit of consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during an organization-defined time period.

Name: Unsuccessful Logon Attempts
Description: The information system shall automatically lock the account/node for an organizational-defined time period; locks the account/node until released by an administrator; delays next logon prompt according to an organization-defined delay period, when the maximum number of unsuccessful logon attempts is exceeded.

Name: System Use Notification
Description: The information system shall display to users an organization-defined system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance and states that: Users are accessing a U.S. Government information system.

Name: System Use Notification
Description: The information system shall display to users an organization-defined system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance and states that: Information system usage may be monitored, recorded, and subject to audit.

Name: System Use Notification
Description: The information system shall display to users an organization-defined system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance and states that: Unauthorized use of the information system is prohibited and subject to criminal and civil penalties.

Name: System Use Notification
Description: The information system shall display to users an organization-defined system use notification message or banner before granting access to the system that provides privacy and security notices consistent with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance and states that: Use of the information system indicates consent to monitoring and recording.

Name: System Use Notification
Description: The information system shall retain the notification message or banner on the screen until users acknowledge the usage conditions and take explicit actions to log on to or further access the information system.

Name: System Use Notification
Description: The information system (with regards to publicly accessible systems), shall display system use information and organization-defined conditions, before granting further access.

Name: System Use Notification
Description: The information system (with regards to publicly accessible systems), shall display references, if any, to monitoring, recording, or auditing that are consistent with privacy accommodations for such systems that generally prohibit those activities.

Name: System Use Notification
Description: The information system (with regards to publicly accessible systems), shall include a description of the authorized users of the system.

Name: Session Lock
Description: The information system shall prevent further access to the system by initiating a session lock after an organization-defined time period of inactivity or upon receiving a request from a user.

Name: Session Lock
Description: The information system shall retain the session lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

Name: Session Lock - Pattern-Hiding Displays
Description: The information system shall conceal, via the session lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image.

Name: Session Termination
Description: The information system shall automatically terminate a user session after organization-defined conditions or trigger events requiring session disconnect.

Name: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
Description: The organization shall identify user actions that can be performed on the information system without identification or authentication consistent with organizational missions/business functions

Name: Permitted Actions Without Identification or Authentication
Description: The organization shall document and provide supporting rationale in the security plan for the information system, user actions not requiring identification or authentication.

Name: Remote Access
Description: The organization shall establish and document usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for each type of remote access allowed.

Name: Remote Access
Description: The organization shall authorize remote access to the information system prior to allowing such connections.

Name: Remote Access - Automated Monitoring/Control
Description: The information system shall monitor and control remote access methods.

Name: Remote Access - Protection of Confidentiality / Integrity Using Encryption
Description: The information system shall implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions.

Name: Remote Access - Managed Access Control Points
Description: The information system shall route all remote access through a set number of managed network access control points.

Name: Remote Access - Privileged Commands / Access
Description: The organization shall authorize the execution of privileged commands and access to security-relevant information via remote access only for organization-defined needs.

Name: Remote Access - Privileged Commands / Access
Description: The organization shall document the rationale for access to security-relevant information in the security plan for the information system.

Name: Wireless Access
Description: The organization shall establish usage restrictions, configuration/connection requirements, and implementation guidance for wireless access.

Name: Wireless Access
Description: The organization shall authorize wireless access to the information system prior to allowing such connections.

Name: Wireless Access - Authentication and Encryption
Description: The information system shall protect wireless access to the system using authentication of either users or devices and uses encryption.

Name: Access Control For Mobile Devices
Description: The organization shall establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, connection requirements, and implementation guidance for organization-controlled mobile devices.

Name: Access Control For Mobile Devices
Description: The organization shall authorize the connection of mobile devices to organizational information systems.

Name: Access Control For Mobile Devices - Full Device / Container-Based Encryption
Description: The organization shall employ either full-device encryption or container encryption to protect the confidentiality and integrity of information on organization-defined mobile devices.

Name: Use of External Information Systems
Description: The organization shall establish terms and conditions, consistent with any trust relationships established with other organizations owning, and/or maintaining external information systems, allowing authorized individuals to access the information system from external information systems.

Name: Use of External Information Systems
Description: The organization shall establish terms and conditions, consistent with any trust relationships established with other organizations owning, and/or maintaining external information systems, allowing authorized individuals to process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information using external information systems.

Name: Use of External Information Systems - Limits on Authorized Use
Description: The organization shall permit authorized individuals to use an external information system to access the information system or to process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information only when the organization verifies the implementation of required security controls on the external system as specified in the organization's information security policy and security plan

Name: Use of External Information Systems - Limits on Authorized Use
Description: The organization shall permit authorized individuals to use an external information system to access the information system or to process, store, or transmit organization-controlled information only when the organization retains approved information system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entity hosting the external information systems.

Name: Use of External Information Systems - Portable Storage Devices
Description: The organization shall restrict or prohibit the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external information systems.

Name: Information Sharing
Description: The organization shall facilitate information sharing by enabling authorized users to determine whether access authorizations assigned to the sharing partner match the access restrictions on the information for organization-defined information sharing circumstances where user discretion is required.

Name: Information Sharing
Description: The organization shall employ organization-defined automated mechanisms or manual processes to assist users in making information sharing/collaboration decisions.

Name: Publicly Accessible Content
Description: The organization shall designate individuals authorized to post information onto a publicly accessible information system.

Name: Publicly Accessible Content
Description: The organization shall train authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain nonpublic information

Name: Publicly Accessible Content
Description: The organization shall review the proposed content of information prior to posting onto the publicly accessible information system to ensure that nonpublic information is not included.

Name: Publicly Accessible Content
Description: The organization shall review the content on the publicly accessible information system for nonpublic information on an organization-defined frequency, and removes such information if it is discovered.

Name: Security Awareness And Training Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel a security awareness and training policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, and responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Security Awareness And Training Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security awareness and training policy and associated security awareness and training controls.

Name: Security Awareness And Training Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current security awareness and training policy on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Security Awareness And Training Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current security awareness and training procedures on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Security Awareness Training
Description: The organization shall provide basic security awareness training to information system users (including manager, senior executives, and contractors) as part of initial training for new users.

Name: Security Awareness Training
Description: The organization shall provide basic security awareness training to information system users (including manager, senior executives, and contractors) when required by information system changes.

Name: Security Awareness Training
Description: The organization shall provide basic security awareness training to information system users (including manager, senior executives, and contractors) on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Security Awareness Training - Insider Threat
Description: The organization shall include security awareness training on recognizing and reporting potential indicators of insider threat.

Name: Role-Based Security Training
Description: The organization shall provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities before authorizing access to the information system or performing assigned duties.

Name: Role-Based Security Training
Description: The organization shall provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities when required by information system changes.

Name: Role-Based Security Training
Description: The organization shall provide role-based security training to personnel with assigned security roles and responsibilities on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Security Training Records
Description: The organization shall document and monitor individual information system security training activities including basic security awareness training and specific information system security training.

Name: Security Training Records
Description: The organization shall retain individual training records for an organization-defined time period.

Name: Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel an audit and accountability policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the audit and accountability policy and associated audit and accountability controls.

Name: Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current audit and accountability policy on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Audit and Accountability Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current audit and accountability procedures on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Audit Events
Description: The organization shall determine that the information system is capable of auditing the events.

Name: Audit Events
Description: The organization shall coordinate the security audit function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information to enhance the mutual support and to help guide the selection of auditable events.

Name: Audit Events
Description: The organization shall provide rationale for why the auditable events are deemed to be adequate to support after-the-fact investigations of security incidents.

Name: Audit Events - Reviews and Updates
Description: The organization shall review and update the audited events on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Audit Events
Description: The organization shall determine that the information system is auditing organization-defined events on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Content of Audit Records
Description: The information system shall generate audit records containing information that establishes what type of event occurred, when the event occurred, where the event occurred, the source of the event, the outcome of the event, and the identity of any individuals or subjects associated with the event.

Name: Content of Audit Records - Additional Audit Information
Description: The information system shall generate audit records containing additional organization-defined information.

Name: Audit Storage Capacity
Description: The organization shall allocate audit record storage capacity in accordance with organization-defined audit record storage requirements.

Name: Response to Audit Processing Failures
Description: The information system shall alert organization-defined personnel in the event of an audit processing failure.

Name: Response to Audit Processing Failures
Description: The information system shall take additional actions such as shutdown, overwrite, stop, in the event of an audit failure.

Name: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting
Description: The organization shall review and analyze information system audit records on an organization-defined frequency for indications of unusual or inappropriate activity.

Name: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting
Description: The organization shall report findings of audit reviews to organization-defined personnel.

Name: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting - Process Integration
Description: The organization shall employ automated mechanisms to integrate audit review, analysis, and reporting processes to support organizational processes for investigation and response to suspicious activities.

Name: Audit Review, Analysis, and Reporting - Correlate Audit Repositories
Description: The organization shall analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness.

Name: Audit Reduction and Report Generation
Description: The information system shall provide an audit reduction and report generation capability that supports on-demand audit review, analysis, and reporting requirements and after-the-fact investigations of security incidents.

Name: Audit Reduction and Report Generation
Description: The information system shall provide an audit reduction and report generation capability that does not alter the original content or time ordering of audit records.

Name: Audit Reduction and Report Generation - Automatic Processing
Description: The information system shall provide the capability to process audit records for events of interest based on organization defined audit fields within audit records.

Name: Time Stamps
Description: The information system shall use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records

Name: Time Stamps
Description: The information system shall record time stamps for audit records that can be mapped to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) and meets organization-defined granularity of time measurement

Name: Time Stamps - Synchronization with Authoritative Time Source
Description: The information system shall compare the internal information system clocks on an organization-defined frequency with an organization-defined authoritative time source.

Name: Time Stamps - Synchronization with Authoritative Time Source
Description: The information system shall synchronize the internal system clocks to the authoritative time source when the time difference is greater than an organization-defined time period.

Name: Protection of Audit Information
Description: The information system shall protect audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

Name: Protection of Audit Information - Access By Subset of Privileged Users
Description: The organization shall authorize access to management of audit functionality to only an organization-defined subset of privileged users.

Name: Audit Record Retention
Description: The organization shall retain audit records for an organization-defined retention period consistent with records retention policies to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.

Name: Audit Generation
Description: The information system shall provide audit record generation capability for the auditable events at organization-defined information system components.

Name: Audit Generation
Description: The information system shall allow organization-defined personnel to select which auditable events are to be audited by specific components or the information system.

Name: Audit Generation
Description: The information shall generate audit records for the defined events with defined content.

Name: Security Assessment and Authorization Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel a security assessment and authorization policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Security Assessment and Authorization Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the security assessment and authorization policy and associated security assessment and authorization controls.

Name: Security Assessment and Authorization Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current security assessment and authorization policy on an organization-defined period.

Name: Security Assessment and Authorization Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current security assessment and authorization procedures on an organization defined frequency.

Name: Security Assessments
Description: The organization shall develop a security assessment plan that describes the scope of the assessment including: security controls and control enhancements under assessment.

Name: Security Assessments
Description: The organization shall develop a security assessment plan that describes the scope of the assessment including: assessment procedures to be used to determine security control effectiveness.

Name: Security Assessments
Description: The organization shall develop a security assessment plan that describes the scope of the assessment including: assessment environment, assessment team, and assessment roles and responsibilities.

Name: Security Assessments
Description: The organization shall assess the security controls in the information system and its environment of operation on an organization-defined frequency to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting established security requirements.

Name: Security Assessments
Description: The organization shall produce a security assessment report that documents the results of the assessment.

Name: Security Assessments - Independent Assessors
Description: The organization shall employ assessors or assessment teams with a level of independence to conduct security control assessments.

Name: Security Assessments
Description: The organization shall provide the results of the security control assessment to organization-defined individuals.

Name: System Interconnections
Description: The organization shall authorize connections from the information system to other information systems through the use of Interconnection Security Agreements.

Name: System Interconnections
Description: The organization shall document, for each interconnection, the interface characteristics, security requirements, and the nature of the information communicated.

Name: System Interconnections
Description: The organization shall review and update the Interconnection Security Agreements on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: System Interconnections - Restrictions on External System Connections
Description: The organization shall employ (allow-all, deny-by-exception, deny-all, permit-by-exception) policy for allowing information systems to connect to external information systems.

Name: Plan of Action and Milestones
Description: The organization shall develop a plan of action and milestones for the information system to document the organization's planned remedial actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during the assessment of the security controls and to reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities in the system

Name: Plan of Action and Milestones
Description: The organization shall update the existing plan of action and milestones on an organization-defined frequency based on the findings from security controls assessments, security impact analyses, and continuous monitoring activities.

Name: Security Authorization
Description: The organization shall assign a senior-level executive or manager as the authorizing official for the information system.

Name: Security Authorization
Description: The organization shall ensure that the authorizing official authorizes the information system for processing before commencing operations.

Name: Security Authorization
Description: The organization shall update the security authorization on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Continuous Monitoring
Description: The organization shall develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement a continuous monitoring program that includes: Establishment of metrics to be monitored.

Name: Continuous Monitoring
Description: The organization shall develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement a continuous monitoring program that includes: Establishment of frequencies for monitoring and frequencies for assessments supporting such monitoring.

Name: Continuous Monitoring
Description: The organization shall develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement a continuous monitoring program that includes: Ongoing security control assessments in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy.

Name: Continuous Monitoring - Independent Assessment
Description: The organization shall employ assessors or assessment teams with a level of independence to monitor the security controls in the information system on an ongoing basis.

Name: Continuous Monitoring
Description: The organization shall develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement a continuous monitoring program that includes: Ongoing security status monitoring of organization-defined metrics in accordance with the organizational continuous monitoring strategy.

Name: Continuous Monitoring
Description: The organization shall develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement a continuous monitoring program that includes: Correlation and analysis of security-related information generated by assessments and monitoring.

Name: Continuous Monitoring
Description: The organization shall develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement a continuous monitoring program that includes: Response actions to address the results of the analysis of security-related information.

Name: Continuous Monitoring
Description: The organization shall develop a continuous monitoring strategy and implement a continuous monitoring program that includes: Reporting the security status of the organization and the information system to organization-defined personnel on a defined frequency.

Name: Internal System Connections
Description: The organization shall authorize internal connections of information system components or classes of components to the information system.

Name: Internal System Connections
Description: The organization shall document, for each internal connection, the interface characteristics, security requirements, and the nature of the information communicated.

Name: Configuration Management Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel a configuration management policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Configuration Management Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the configuration management policy and associated configuration management controls.

Name: Configuration Management Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current configuration management policy on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Configuration Management Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current configuration management procedures on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Baseline Configuration
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and maintain under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the information system.

Name: Baseline Configuration - Reviews and updates
Description: The organization shall review and update the baseline configuration of the information system on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Baseline Configuration - Reviews and updates
Description: The organization shall review and update the baseline configuration of the information system when required due to organization-defined circumstances

Name: Baseline Configuration - Reviews and updates
Description: The organization shall review and update the baseline configuration of the information system as an integral part of information system component installations and upgrades.

Name: Baseline Configuration - Retention of Previous Configurations
Description: The organization shall retain previous versions of baseline configurations of the information system to support rollback.

Name: Baseline Configuration - Configure Systems, Components, or Devices For High-Risk Areas
Description: The organization shall issue information system, system components, or devices with configurations to individuals traveling to locations that the organization deems to be of significant risk

Name: Baseline Configuration - Configure Systems, Components, or Devices For High-Risk Areas
Description: The organization shall apply security safeguards to the devices when individuals return from areas deemed to be of significant risk.

Name: Configuration Change Control
Description: The organization shall determine the types of changes to the information system that are configuration-controlled.

Name: Configuration Change Control
Description: The organization shall review proposed configuration-controlled changes to the information system and approves or disapproves such changes with explicit consideration for security impact analyses.

Name: Configuration Change Control
Description: The organization shall document configuration change decisions associated with the information system.

Name: Configuration Change Control - Test / Validate / Document Changes
Description: The organization shall test, validate, and document changes to the information system before implementing the changes on the operational system.

Name: Configuration Change Control
Description: The organization shall implement approved configuration-controlled changes to the information system.

Name: Configuration Change Control
Description: The organization shall retain records of configuration-controlled changes to the information system for a defined time-period.

Name: Configuration Change Control
Description: The organization shall audit and review activities associated with configuration-controlled changes to the information system.

Name: Configuration Change Control
Description: The organization shall coordinate and provide oversight for configuration change control activities through a configuration change control committee that convenes on an organization-defined frequency or under defined conditions.

Name: Security Impact Analysis
Description: The organization shall analyze changes to the information system to determine potential security impacts prior to change implementation.

Name: Access Restrictions For Change
Description: The organization shall define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to the information system.

Name: Configuration Settings
Description: The organization shall establish and document configuration settings for information technology products employed within the information system using security configuration checklists that reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements.

Name: Configuration Settings
Description: The organization shall implement information technology configuration settings.

Name: Configuration Settings
Description: The organization shall identify, document, and approve any deviations from established configuration settings for information system components based on operational requirements.

Name: Configuration Settings
Description: The organization shall monitor and control changes to the configuration settings in accordance with organizational policies and procedures.

Name: Least Functionality
Description: The organization shall configure the information system to provide only essential capabilities

Name: Least Functionality
Description: The organization shall prohibit or restrict the use of unnecessary functions, ports, protocols, and or/services.

Name: Least Functionality - Periodic Review
Description: The organization shall review the information system on an organization-defined frequency to identify unnecessary and/or nonsecure functions, ports, protocols, and services.

Name: Least Functionality - Periodic Review
Description: The organization shall disable functions, ports, protocols, and services within the information system deemed to be unnecessary and/or nonsecure.

Name: Least Functionality - Prevent Program Execution
Description: The information system shall prevent program execution in accordance with organization-defined policies regarding software program usage and restrictions and/or rules authorizing the terms and conditions of software usage.

Name: Least Functionality - Unauthorized Software / Blacklisting
Description: The organization shall identify software programs not authorized to execute on the information system.

Name: Least Functionality - Unauthorized Software / Blacklisting
Description: The organization shall employ an allow-all,deny-by-execution policy to prohibit the execution of unauthorized software programs on the information system.

Name: Least Functionality - Unauthorized Software / Blacklisting
Description: The organization shall review and update the list of unauthorized software programs on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Information System Component Inventory
Description: The organization shall develop and document an inventory of information system components that accurately reflects the current information system.

Name: Information System Component Inventory
Description: The organization shall develop and document an inventory of information system components that includes all components within the authorization boundary of the information system.

Name: Information System Component Inventory
Description: The organization shall develop and document an inventory of information system components that is at the level of granularity deemed necessary for tracking and reporting

Name: Information System Component Inventory
Description: The organization shall develop and document an inventory of information system components that includes information deemed necessary to achieve effective information system component accountability.

Name: Information System Component Inventory
Description: The organization shall review and update the information system component inventory on an organization-defined frequency

Name: Information System Component Inventory - Updates During Installations / Removals
Description: The organization shall update the inventory of information system components as an integral part of component installations, removals, and information system updates.

Name: Information System Component Inventory - Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
Description: The organization shall employ automated mechanisms on an organization-defined frequency to detect the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components within the information system.

Name: Information System Component Inventory - Automated Unauthorized Component Detection
Description: The organization shall take one or more of the following actions when unauthorized components are detected: disable network access, isolate components, notify organization-defined personnel.

Name: Information System Component Inventory -No Duplicate Accounting of Components
Description: The organization shall verify that all components within the authorization boundary of the information system are not duplicated in other information system inventories.

Name: Configuration Management Plan
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and implement a configuration management plan for the information system that addresses roles, responsibilities, and configuration management processes and procedures.

Name: Configuration Management Plan
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and implement a configuration management plan for the information system that establishes a process for identifying configuration items throughout the system development life cycle and for managing the configuration of the configuration items.

Name: Configuration Management Plan
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and implement a configuration management plan for the information system that defines the configuration items for the information system and places the configuration items under configuration management

Name: Configuration Management Plan
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and implement a configuration management plan for the information system that protects the configuration management plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification

Name: Software Usage Restrictions
Description: The organization shall use software and associated documentation in accordance with contract agreements and copyright laws.

Name: Software Usage Restrictions
Description: The organization shall track the use of software and associated documentation protected by quantity licenses to control copying and distribution.

Name: Software Usage Restrictions
Description: The organization shall control and document the use of peer-to-peer file sharing technology to ensure that this capability is not used for the unauthorized distribution, display, performance, or reproduction of copyrighted work.

Name: User-Installed Software
Description: The organization shall establish policies governing the installation of software by users.

Name: User-Installed Software
Description: The organization shall enforce software installation policies.

Name: User-Installed Software
Description: The organization shall monitor the compliance of software installation policies on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Contingency Planning Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel a contingency planning policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Contingency Planning Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the contingency planning policy and associated contingency planning controls.

Name: Contingency Planning Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current contingency planning policy on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Contingency Planning Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current contingency planning procedures on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall develop a contingency plan for the information system that identifies essential missions and business functions and associated contingency requirements.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization sha lldevelop a contingency plan for the information system that provides recovery objectives, restoration priorities, and metrics.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall develop a contingency plan for the information system that addresses contingency roles, responsibilities, assigned individuals with contact information.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall develop a contingency plan for the information system that addresses maintaining essential missions and business functions despite an information system disruption, compromise, or failure.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall develop a contingency plan for the information system that addresses eventual, full information system restoration without deterioration of the security safeguards originally planned and implemented.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall develop a contingency plan for the information system that is reviewed and approved organization defined personnel.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall distribute copies of the contingency plan to key contingency personnel and organizational key individuals.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall coordinate contingency planing activities with incident handling activities.

Name: Contingency Plan - Coordinate With Related Plans
Description: The organization shall coordinate contingency plan development with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

Name: Contingency Plan - Resume Essential Missions / Business Functions
Description: The organization shall plan for the resumption of essential missions and business function within a defined time period of contingency plan activation.

Name: Contingency Plan - Identify Critical Assets
Description: The organization shall identify critical information system assets supporting essential missions and business functions.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall review the contingency plan for the information system on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall update the contingency plan to address changes to the organization, information system, or environment of operation and problems encountered during contingency plan implementation, execution, or testing.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall communicate contingency plan changes to key contingency personnel and key organization personnel.

Name: Contingency Plan
Description: The organization shall protect the contingency plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.

Name: Contingency Training
Description: The organization shall provide contingency training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities within a defined time period of assuming a contingency role of responsibility.

Name: Contingency Training
Description: The organization shall provide contingency training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities when required by information system changes.

Name: Contingency Training
Description: The organization shall provide contingency training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities on a defined frequency thereafter.

Name: Contingency Plan Testing
Description: The organization shall test the contingency plan for the information system on a defined frequency using tests to determine the effectiveness of the plan and the organizational readiness to execute the plan.

Name: Contingency Plan Testing
Description: The organization shall review the contingency plan test results.

Name: Contingency Plan Testing
Description: The organization shall initiate corrective actions, based on contingency plan test results, if needed.

Name: Contingency Plan Testing - Coordinate With Related Plans
Description: The organization shall coordinate contingency plan testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

Name: Alternate Storage Site
Description: The organization shall establish an alternate storage site including necessary agreements to permit the storage and retrieval of information system backup information.

Name: Alternate Storage Site
Description: The organization shall ensure that the alternate storage site provides information security safeguards equivalent to that of the primary site.

Name: Alternate Storage Site - Separation From Primary Site
Description: The organization shall identify an alternate storage site that is separated from the primary storage site to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

Name: Alternate Storage Site - Accessibility
Description: The organization shall identify potential accessibility problems to the alternate storage site in the event of an area-wide disruption of disaster and outlines explicit mitigation.

Name: Alternate Processing Site
Description: The organization shall establish an alternate processing site including necessary agreements to permit the transfer and resumption of information system operations for essential mission/business functions within an organization-defined time period consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives when the primary processing capabilities are unavailable.

Name: Alternate Processing Site
Description: The organization shall ensure that equipment and supplies required to transfer and resume operations are available at the alternate processing site or contracts are in place to support delivery to the site within the organization-defined time period for transfer/resumption

Name: Alternate Processing Site
Description: The organization shall ensure that the alternate processing site provides information security safeguards equivalent to that of the primary site.

Name: Alternate Processing Site - Separation From Primary Site
Description: The organization shall identify an alternate processing site that is separated from the primary processing site to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

Name: Alternate Processing Site - Accessibility
Description: The organization shall identify potential accessibility problems to the alternate processing site in the event of an area-wide disruption or disaster and outlines explicit mitigation actions.

Name: Alternate Processing Site - Priority Of Service
Description: The organization shall develop alternate processing site agreements that contain priority-of-service provisions in accordance with organizational availability requirements (including recovery time objectives)

Name: Telecommunication Services
Description: The organization shall establish alternate telecommunications services including necessary agreements to permit the resumption of information system operations for essential missions and business functions within an organization-defined time period when the primary telecommunications capabilities are unavailable at either the primary or alternate processing or storage sites.

Name: Telecommunication Services - Priority of Service
Description: The organization shall develop primary and alternate telecommunications service agreements that contain priority-of-service provisions in accordance with organizational availability requirements (including recovery time objectives)

Name: Telecommunication Services - Priority of Service
Description: The organization shall request telecommunications service priority for all telecommunications services used for national security emergency preparedness in the event that the primary and/or alternate telecommunications services are provided by a common carrier.

Name: Telecommunication Services - Single Points of Failure
Description: The organization shall obtain alternate telecommunications services to reduce the likelihood of sharing a single point of failure with primary telecommunications services.

Name: Information System Backup
Description: The organization shall conduct backups of user-level information contained in the information system on an organization-defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives.

Name: Information System Backup
Description: The organization shall conduct backups of system-level information contained in the information system on an organization-defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives.

Name: Information System Backup
Description: The organization shall conduct backups of information system documentation including security-related documentation on an organization defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives.

Name: Information System Backup - Testing For Reliability / Integrity
Description: The organization shall test backup information on an organization-defined frequency to verify media reliability and information integrity.

Name: Information System Backup
Description: The organization shall protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of backup information at storage locations.

Name: Information System Recovery And Reconstitution
Description: The organization shall provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the information system to a known state after a disruption, compromise, or failure.

Name: Information System Recovery And Reconstitution - Transaction Recovery
Description: The information system shall implement transaction recovery for systems that are transaction-based.

Name: Identification And Authentication Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel an identification and authentication policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Identification And Authentication Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the identification and authentication policy and associated identification and authentication controls.

Name: Identification And Authentication Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current identification and authentication policy on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Identification And Authentication Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current identification and authentication procedures on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users)
Description: The information system shall uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of organizational users)

Name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) - Network Access To Privileged Accounts
Description: The information system shall implement multi-factor authentication for network access to privileged accounts.

Name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) - Network Access To Non-Privileged Accounts
Description: The information system shall implement multi-factor authentication for network access to non-privileged accounts.

Name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) - Local Access To Privileged Accounts
Description: The information system shall implement multi-factor authentication for local access to privileged accounts.

Name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) - Network Access To Privileged Accounts - Replay Resistant
Description: The information system shall implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms or network access to privileged accounts.

Name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) - Remote Access - Separate Device
Description: The information system shall implement multi-factor authentication for remote access to privileged and non-privileged accounts such that one of the factors is provided by a device separate from the system gaining access and the device meets organization-defined strength of mechanism requirements.

Name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational Users) - Acceptance of PIV Credentials
Description: The information system shall accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials.

Name: Device Identification and Authentication
Description: The information system shall uniquely identify and authenticate organization-defined specific and/or types of devices before establishing a (local;remote;network) connection.

Name: Identifier Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system identifiers by receiving authorization from organization-defined personnel to assign an individual, group, role, or device identifier.

Name: Identifier Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system identifiers by selecting an identifier that identifies an individual, group, role, or device.

Name: Identifier Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system identifiers by assigning the identifier to the intended individual, group, role, or device.

Name: Identifier Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system identifiers by preventing reuse of identifiers for an organization-defined time period

Name: Identifier Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system identifiers by disabling the identifier after an organization-defined time period of inactivity.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by verifying, as part of the initial authenticator distribution, the identity of the individual, group, role, or device receiving the authenticator.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by establishing initial authenticator content for authenticators defined by the organization.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by ensuring the authenticators have sufficient strength of mechanism for their intended use.

Name: Authenticator Management - Password Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for password-based authentication shall enforce a minimum password complexity with requirements on case sensitivity, number of characters, mix of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers, and special characters, including minimum requirements for each type.

Name: Authenticator Management - Password Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for password-based authentication shall enforce a requirement on the number of changed characters when new passwords are created.

Name: Authenticator Management - Password Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for password-based authentication shall store and transmit only encrypted representations of passwords.

Name: Authenticator Management - Password Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for password-based authentication shall enforce password minimum and maximum lifetime restrictions defined by the organization.

Name: Authenticator Management - Password Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for password-based authentication shall prohibit password reuse for an organization defined number of generations.

Name: Authenticator Management - Password Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for password-based authentication shall allow the use of temporary password for system logons with an immediate change to a permanent password.

Name: Authenticator Management - PKI Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for PKI based authentication shall validate certifications by constructing and verifying a certification path to an accepted trust anchor including checking certificate status information.

Name: Authenticator Management - PKI Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for PKI based authentication shall enforce authorized access to the corresponding private key.

Name: Authenticator Management - PKI Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for PKI based authentication shall map the authenticated identity to the account of the individual or group.

Name: Authenticator Management - PKI Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for PKI based authentication shall implement a local cache of revocation data to support path discovery and validation in case of inability to access revocation information via the network.

Name: Authenticator Management - In-Person Or Trusted Third-Party Registration
Description: The organization shall require that the registration process to receive an organization-defined authenticator be conducted (in person/by a trusted third party) before the registration authority with authorization by organization-defined personnel.

Name: Authenticator Management - Hardware Token-Based Authentication
Description: The information system, for hardware token-based authentication, shall employ mechanisms that satisfy token quality requirements.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by establishing and implementing administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution, for lost/compromised of damaged authenticators, and for revoking authenticators.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by changing default content of authenticators prior to information system installation.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by establishing minimum and maximum lifetime restrictions and reuse conditions for authenticators.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by changing/refreshing authenticators on an organization defined time period by authenticator type.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by protecting authenticator content from unauthorized disclosure and modification.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by requiring individuals to take, and having devices implement, specific security safeguards to protect authenticators.

Name: Authenticator Management
Description: The organization shall manage information system authenticators by changing authenticators for group/role accounts when membership to those accounts changes.

Name: Authenticator Feedback
Description: The information system shall obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process to protect the information from possible exploitation/use by unauthorized individuals.

Name: Cryptographic Module Authentication
Description: The information system shall implement mechanisms for authentication to a cryptographic module that meet the requirements of applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and guidance for such authentication.

Name: Identification And Authentication (Non-Organizational Users)
Description: The information system shall uniquely identify and authenticate non-organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of non-organizational users).

Name: Identification And Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) - Acceptance of PIV Credentials From Other Agencies
Description: The information system shall accept and electronically verify Personal Identity Verification (PIV) credentials from other federal agencies.

Name: Identification And Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) - Acceptance of Third-Party Credentials
Description: The information system shall accept only FICAM-approved third-party credentials.

Name: Identification And Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) - Use of FICAM-Approved Products.
Description: The organization shall employ only FICAM-approved information system components in information systems to accept third-party credentials.

Name: Identification And Authentication (Non-Organizational Users) - Use of FICAM-Issued Profiles
Description: The information system shall conform to FICAM-Issued profiles.

Name: Incident Response Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel an incident response policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Incident Response Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the incident response policy and associated incident response controls.

Name: Incident Response Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current incident response policy on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Incident Response Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current incident response procedures on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Incident Response Training
Description: The organization shall provide incident response training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities within an organization-defined time period of assuming an incident response role or responsibility

Name: Incident Response Training
Description: The organization shall provide incident response training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities when required by information system changes

Name: Incident Response Training
Description: The organization shall provide incident response training to information system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Incident Response Testing
Description: The organization shall test the incident response capability for the information system on an organization-defined frequency using tests to determine the incident response effectiveness and documents the results.

Name: Incident Response Testing - Coordination With Related Plans
Description: The organization shall coordinate incident response testing with organizational elements responsible for related plans.

Name: Incident Handling
Description: The organization shall implement an incident handling capability for security incidents that includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

Name: Incident Handling
Description: The organization shall coordinate incident handling activities with contingency planning activities.

Name: Incident Handling
Description: The organization shall incorporate lessons learned from ongoing incident handling activities into incident response procedures, training, and testing/exercises, and implement the resulting changes accordingly.

Name: Incident Handling - Automated Incident Handling Procedures
Description: The organization shall employ automated mechanisms to support the incident handling process.

Name: Incident Monitoring
Description: The organization shall track and document information system security incidents.

Name: Incident Reporting
Description: The organization shall require personnel to report suspected security incidents to the organizational incident response capability within an organization-defined time period.

Name: Incident Reporting
Description: The organization shall report security incident information to organization-defined authorities.

Name: Incident Reporting - Automated Reporting
Description: The organization shall employ automated mechanisms to assist in the reporting of security incidents.

Name: Incident Response Assistance
Description: The organization shall provide an incident response support resource, integral to the organization incident response capability that offers advice and assistance to users of the information system for the handling and reporting of security incidents.

Name: Incident Response Assistance - Automation Support For Availability of Information / Support
Description: The organization shall employ automated mechanisms to increase the availability of incident response-related information and support.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall develop an incident response plan that provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall develop an incident response plan that describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall develop an incident response plan that provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall develop an incident response plan that meets the unique requirements of the organization, which relate to mission, size, structure, and function.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall develop an incident response plan that defines reportable incidents.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall develop an incident response plan that provides metrics for measuring the incident response capability within the organization.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall develop an incident response plan that defines the resources and management support needed to effectively maintain and mature an incident response capability.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall develop an incident response plan that is reviewed and approved by organization-defined personnel.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall distribute copies of the incident response plan to organization defined incident response personnel and other key organizational personnel.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall review the incident response plan on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall update the incident response plan to address system/organizational changes or problems encountered during plan implementation, execution, or testing.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall communicate incident response plan changes to organization-defined incident response personnel and other key organization personnel.

Name: Incident Response Plan
Description: The organization shall protect the incident response plan from unauthorized disclosure and modification.

Name: System Maintenance Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel a system maintenance policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: System Maintenance Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system maintenance and associated system maintenance controls.

Name: System Maintenance Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current system maintenance policy on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: System Maintenance Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current system maintenance procedures on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Controlled Maintenance
Description: The organization shall schedule, perform, document, and review records of maintenance and repairs on information system components in accordance with manufacturer or vendor specifications and/or organizational requirements.

Name: Controlled Maintenance
Description: The organization shall approve and monitor all maintenance activities, whether performed on site or remotely and whether the equipment is serviced on site or removed to another location.

Name: Controlled Maintenance
Description: The organization shall require that organization-defined personnel explicitly approve the removal of the information system or system components from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance or repairs.

Name: Controlled Maintenance
Description: The organization shall sanitize equipment to remove all information from associated media prior to removal from organizational facilities for off-site maintenance or repairs.

Name: Controlled Maintenance
Description: The organization shall check all potentially impacted security controls to verify that the controls are still functioning properly following maintenance or repair actions.

Name: Controlled Maintenance
Description: The organization shall include maintenance-related information in organizational maintenance records.

Name: Maintenance Tools
Description: The organization shall approve, control, and monitor information system maintenance tools.

Name: Maintenance Tools - Inspect Tools
Description: The organization shall inspect the maintenance tools carried into a facility by maintenance personnel for improper or unauthorized modifications.

Name: Maintenance Tools - Inspect Media
Description: The organization shall check media containing diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before the media are used in the information system.

Name: Non-Local Maintenance
Description: The organization shall approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities.

Name: Non-Local Maintenance
Description: The organization shall allow the use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic tools only as consistent with organizational policy and documented in the security plan for the information system.

Name: Non-Local Maintenance
Description: The organization shall employ strong authenticators in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance diagnostic sessions.

Name: Non-Local Maintenance - Document Nonlocal Maintenance
Description: The organization shall document in the security plan for the information system, the policies and procedures for the establishment and use of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic connections.

Name: Non-Local Maintenance
Description: The organization shall maintain records for nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities.

Name: Non-Local Maintenance
Description: The organization shall terminate session and network connections when nonlocal maintenance is completed.

Name: Maintenance Personnel
Description: The organization shall establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization and maintain a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel.

Name: Maintenance Personnel
Description: The organization shall ensure that non-escorted personnel performing maintenance on the information system have required access authorizations.

Name: Maintenance Personnel
Description: The organization shall designate organizational personnel with required access authorizations and technical competence to supervise the maintenance activities of personnel who do not possess the required access authorizations.

Name: Timely Maintenance
Description: The organization shall obtain maintenance support and/or spare parts for information system components within an organization-defined time period of failure.

Name: Media Protection Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel a media protection policy that addresses purpose, scope, roles, responsibilities, management commitment, coordination among organizational entities, and compliance.

Name: Media Protection Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall develop, document, and disseminate to organization-defined personnel procedures to facilitate the implementation of the media protection policy and associated media protection controls.

Name: Media Protection Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current media protection policy on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Media Protection Policy and Procedures
Description: The organization shall review and update the current media protection procedures on an organization-defined frequency.

Name: Media Access
Description: The organization shall restrict access to organization-defined types of digital and/or non-digital media to organization-defined personnel.

Name: Media Marking
Description: The organization shall mark information system media indicating the distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable security markings (if any) of the information.

Name: Media Marking
Description: The organization shall exempt certain types of information system media from marking as long as the media remain within controlled areas.

Name: Media Storage
Description: The organization shall physically control and securely store certain types of digital and/or non-digital media within controlled areas.

Name: Media Storage
Description: The organization shall protect information system media until the media are destroyed or sanitized using approved equipment, techniques, and procedures.

Name: Media Transport
Description: The organization shall protect types of information system media during transport outside of controlled areas using security safeguards.

Name: Media Transport
